summary: Dissemination, in the context of these documents, refers to the act of distributing information to various parties. The documents highlight the process of disseminating information, whether it be an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray to relevant authorities, Order of Battle reports within an organization, or security information regarding Mark Lane to law enforcement and intelligence agencies. The process involves routing, editing, and distributing information to relevant parties, both within the US and internationally. The documents show dissemination as a crucial step in intelligence and law enforcement operations.
significance: In the JFK context, dissemination is significant as it highlights how information related to individuals and events connected to the assassination was shared among various agencies and individuals. The dissemination of the Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray shows the effort to identify and apprehend suspects. The dissemination of information regarding Mark Lane, a critic of the Warren Commission, suggests monitoring and information sharing related to individuals involved in the JFK assassination narrative.
